intro: Penthysa strigosa, commonly known as the rough-stemmed penta, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has rough, hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in groups of five. Penthysa strigosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
